intro: Tetragonia pentandra, commonly known as New Zealand spinach, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, edible leaves that are often used in culinary applications. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a trailing habit, forming dense mats on the ground. Its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Tetragonia pentandra is valued for its nutritional content and ability to thrive in saline environments.
